author: __flcl
content:
Hi guys! One more EL-side eip-4844 implementer here
<@159152274659082240> the clean-slate branch crashes on windows for me, on other side I saw a new branch - eip-4844. Is there any chance it's better to work on the eip using that branch?

author: bridge-bot
content: <adietrichs> I think it was <@539495253418180618> who pointed out that the new transaction type in the EIP do not follow EIP-1559 (e.g. it uses `max_basefee_per_gas` instead of `max_fee_per_gas`, which is a significant difference)

author: bridge-bot
content: <adietrichs> I assume this is not on purpose? I am about to open a PR for the fee market changes, could add a fix to the tx fields to that, unless people would prefer a separate PR for a fix

author: bridge-bot
content: <adietrichs> I went ahead with including it in my PR, which is now published:

author: bridge-bot
content: <adietrichs> would appreciate feedback, most of the changes are the result of a discussion with @vbuterin during SBC.

author: protolambda
content: <@415548822983278593> Changes look good to me, thank you. One small syntax nit though

author: inphi
content: hey <@277500722655002624> . Yes, please build on top of the eip-4844 branch as it's the most recent development branch. The clean-slate branch is old and is only used for the current devnet.

author: __flcl
content: Thanks! By the way, is the any chance some nodes of some *testnet* support the eip?

author: inphi
content: Do you mean if there are nodes running on a testnet right now that also supports the eip? If so, there aren't.

author: danielknopik
content: <@159152274659082240> , I suspect that there is a bug in the generated block types here: https://github.com/Inphi/prysm/blob/aee1a2db4e6c78c77e38949d2345c364fc5b41ee/proto/prysm/v1alpha1/generated.ssz.go#L5655 The size parameter to ssz.CalculateLimit is 0 for some reason, so ssz.CalculateLimit is returning numSize (or 1 if numSize is zero), so the limit provided to MerkleizeWithMixin is incorrect, as it should be 16, right? (this might be the cause why our Lighthouse fork disagrees with the parent roots in the devnet chain, but I am not 100% sure)

author: inphi
content:
Yeah that's like a bug for sure in eip4844 prysm. The roots won't match if there are no kzgs commitments. Thanks for looking into this.
I'd love to add the Lighthouse fork to https://github.com/Inphi/eip4844-interop so we can better spot these issues.

author: danielknopik
content: I still need to clean it up a little and finish at least proper syncing of the sidecars ðŸ˜…  but that is a fantastic resource for further testing, thx! I'll let you know when I'm happy with the fork, then you can add it.

author: danielknopik
content: (also, this fork might not make it as I am unsure how much time I can dedicate to it in the future and if the implementation nice enough to be continued by sigp or someone)
